intro: Fridericia caudigera, commonly known as the long-tailed fridericia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and elliptical, dark green leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Fridericia caudigera is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
